Feature.Description: This Feature allows a SiLA Client to lock a SiLA Server for exclusive use, preventing other SiLA Clients from using the server while it is locked. To lock a SiLA Server a lock identifier has to be set, using the 'LockServer' command. This identifier has to be sent with every (lock protected) call to the SiLA Server in order to use it's functionality. To sent the identifier the SiLA Client Meta Data 'LockIdentifier' has to be used. When locking a SiLA Server a timeout can be specified that defines the time after which the SiLA Server will be automatically unlocked if no call with valid lock id has been received meanwhile. After the timeout has expired or after explicit unlock no lock identifier has to be sent any more.

Command.Description: Locks a SiLA Server for exclusive use by setting a lock identifier that has to be sent with any following (lock protected) calls as long as the server is locked.

Parameter.Description: The lock identifier that has to be sent with every (lock protected) call to use the server's functionality.
The time [s] after a SiLA Server is automatically unlocked when no call with valid lock identifier is received meanwhile. A timeout of 0 specifies an infinite time (no timeout).

Command.Description: Unlocks a locked SiLA Server. No lock identifier has to be sent for any following calls until the server is locked again.

Property.Description: Returns true if the SiLA Server is currently locked or false else. This property MUST NOT be lock protected, so that any SiLA Client can query the current lock state of a SiLA Server.

StandardExecutionError.Description: The sent lock identifier is not valid.
The SiLA Server can not be locked because it is already locked.
The SiLA Server can not be unlocked because it is not locked.

Metadata.Description: The lock identifier has to be sent with every (lock protected) call in order to use the functionality of a locked SiLA Server.
